   19: %%
   20: -module(beam_lib_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %%-define(debug, true).
   23: 
   24: -ifdef(debug).
   25: -define(format(S, A), io:format(S, A)).
   26: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   27: -define(config(X,Y), "./log_dir/").
   28: -define(privdir, "beam_lib_SUITE_priv").
   29: -else.
   30: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   31: -define(format(S, A), ok).
   32: -define(privdir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Conf)).
   33: -endif.
   34: 
   35: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   36: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   37: 	 normal/1, error/1, cmp/1, cmp_literals/1, strip/1, strip_add_chunks/1, otp_6711/1,
   38:          building/1, md5/1, encrypted_abstr/1, encrypted_abstr_file/1,
   39:          missing_debug_info_backend/1]).
   40: -export([test_makedep_abstract_code/1]).
   41: 
   42: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   43: 
   44: suite() ->
   45:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   46:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   47: 
   48: all() -> 
   49:     [error, normal, cmp, cmp_literals, strip, strip_add_chunks, otp_6711,
   50:      building, md5, encrypted_abstr, encrypted_abstr_file,
   51:      missing_debug_info_backend, test_makedep_abstract_code
   52:     ].
   53: 
   54: groups() -> 
   55:     [].
   56: 
   57: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   61:     %% Cleanup after strip and strip_add_chunks
   62:     case code:is_sticky(sofs) of
   63:         false ->
   64:             false = code:purge(sofs),
   65:             {module, sofs} = code:load_file(sofs),
   66:             code:stick_mod(sofs),
   67:             ok;
   68:         true ->
   69:             ok
   70:     end.
   71: 
   72: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   73:     Config.
   74: 
   75: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   76:     Config.
   77: 
   78: 
   79: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   80:     Config.
   81: 
   82: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   83:     ok.
   84: 
   85: %% Read correct beam file.
   86: normal(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
   87:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
   88:     Simple = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple"),
   89:     Source = Simple ++ ".erl",
   90:     BeamFile = Simple ++ ".beam",
   91:     simple_file(Source),
   92: 
   93:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
   94:     P0 = pps(),
   95: 
   96:     do_normal(Source, PrivDir, BeamFile, []),
   97:     do_normal(Source, PrivDir, BeamFile, [r27]),
   98: 
   99:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, [{outdir,PrivDir}, no_debug_info]),
  100:     {ok, {simple, [{debug_info, {debug_info_v1, erl_abstract_code, {none, _}}}]}} =
  101: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [debug_info]),
  102:     {ok, {simple, [{abstract_code, no_abstract_code}]}} =
  103: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [abstract_code]),
  104: 
  105:     %% {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, [compressed | CompileFlags]),
  106:     %% do_normal(BeamFile),
  107: 
  108:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  109:     file:delete(Source),
  110:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  111:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  112:     ok.
  113: 
  114: do_normal(Source, PrivDir, BeamFile, Opts) ->
  115:     CompileFlags = [{outdir,PrivDir}, debug_info | Opts],
  116:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, CompileFlags),
  117:     {ok, Binary} = file:read_file(BeamFile),
  118: 
  119:     do_normal(BeamFile, Opts),
  120:     do_normal(Binary, Opts).
  121: 
  122: do_normal(BeamFile, _Opts) ->
  123:     Imports = {imports, [{erlang, get_module_info, 1},
  124: 			 {erlang, get_module_info, 2},
  125: 			 {lists, member, 2}]},
  126:     Exports = {exports, [{module_info, 0}, {module_info, 1}, {t, 0}]},
  127:     Local = {locals, [{t, 1}]},
  128:     {ok, {simple, [Imports]}} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [imports]),
  129:     {ok, {simple, [{"ImpT",_Bin}]}} =
  130: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, ["ImpT"]),
  131:     {ok, {simple, [Exports]}} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [exports]),
  132:     {ok, {simple, [{attributes, [{vsn, [_]}]}]}} =
  133: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [attributes]),
  134:     {ok, {simple, [{compile_info, _}=CompileInfo]}} =
  135: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [compile_info]),
  136:     {ok, {simple, [Local]}} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [locals]),
  137:     {ok, {simple, [{attributes, [{vsn, [_]}]}, CompileInfo,
  138: 		   Exports, Imports, Local]}} =
  139: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [attributes, compile_info, exports, imports, locals]),
  140:     {ok, {simple, [{atoms, _Atoms}]}} =
  141: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [atoms]),
  142:     {ok, {simple, [{labeled_exports, _LExports}]}} =
  143: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [labeled_exports]),
  144:     {ok, {simple, [{labeled_locals, _LLocals}]}} =
  145: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [labeled_locals]),
  146:     {ok, {simple, [_Vsn]}} = beam_lib:version(BeamFile),
  147:     {ok, {simple, [{abstract_code, {_, _}}]}} =
  148: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [abstract_code]),
  149:     {ok, {simple, [{debug_info, {debug_info_v1, erl_abstract_code, _}}]}} =
  150: 	beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [debug_info]),
  151: 
  152:     %% Test reading optional chunks.
  153:     All = ["Atom", "Code", "StrT", "ImpT", "ExpT", "FunT", "LitT", "AtU8"],
  154:     {ok,{simple,Chunks}} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, All, [allow_missing_chunks]),
  155:     {missing_chunk, AtomBin} = verify_simple(Chunks),
  156:     true = is_binary(AtomBin),
  157: 
  158:     %% 'allow_missing_chunks' should work for named chunks too.
  159:     {ok, {simple, StrippedBeam}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFile),
  160:     {ok, {simple, MChunks}} = beam_lib:chunks(StrippedBeam,
  161:                                               [attributes, locals],
  162:                                               [allow_missing_chunks]),
  163:     [{attributes, missing_chunk}, {locals, missing_chunk}] = MChunks,
  164: 
  165:     %% Make sure that reading the atom chunk works when the 'allow_missing_chunks'
  166:     %% option is used.
  167:     Some = ["Code",atoms,"ExpT","LitT"],
  168:     {ok,{simple,SomeChunks}} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, Some, [allow_missing_chunks]),
  169:     [{"Code",<<_/binary>>},{atoms,[_|_]},{"ExpT",<<_/binary>>},{"LitT",missing_chunk}] =
  170: 	SomeChunks.
  171: 
  172: verify_simple([{"Atom", PlainAtomChunk},
  173: 	       {"Code", CodeBin},
  174: 	       {"StrT", StrBin},
  175: 	       {"ImpT", ImpBin},
  176: 	       {"ExpT", ExpBin},
  177: 	       {"FunT", missing_chunk},
  178: 	       {"LitT", missing_chunk},
  179: 	       {"AtU8", AtU8Chunk}])
  180:   when is_binary(CodeBin), is_binary(StrBin),
  181:        is_binary(ImpBin), is_binary(ExpBin) ->
  182:     {PlainAtomChunk, AtU8Chunk}.
  183: 
  184: %% Read invalid beam files.
  185: error(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  186:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  187:     Simple = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple"),
  188:     Source = Simple ++ ".erl",
  189:     BeamFile = Simple ++ ".beam",
  190:     WrongFile = Simple ++ "foo.beam",
  191:     simple_file(Source),
  192: 
  193:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  194:     P0 = pps(),
  195:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, [{outdir,PrivDir},debug_info]),
  196:     ACopy = filename:join(PrivDir, "a_copy.beam"),
  197:     copy_file(BeamFile, ACopy),
  198: 
  199:     {ok, Binary} = file:read_file(BeamFile),
  200: 
  201:     copy_file(ACopy, WrongFile),
  202:     verify(file_error, beam_lib:info("./does_simply_not_exist")),
  203: 
  204:     do_error(BeamFile, ACopy),
  205:     do_error(Binary, ACopy),
  206: 
  207:     copy_file(ACopy, BeamFile),
  208:     verify(unknown_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [not_a_chunk])),
  209: 
  210:     ok = file:write_file(BeamFile, <<>>),
  211:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(BeamFile)),
  212:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(<<>>)),
  213:     ok = file:write_file(BeamFile, <<"short">>),
  214:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(BeamFile)),
  215:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(<<"short">>)),
  216: 
  217:     {Binary1, _} = split_binary(Binary, byte_size(Binary)-10),
  218:     LastChunk = last_chunk(Binary),
  219:     verify(chunk_too_big, beam_lib:chunks(Binary1, [LastChunk])),
  220:     Chunks = chunk_info(Binary),
  221:     {value, {_, DebugInfoStart, _}} = lists:keysearch("Dbgi", 1, Chunks),
  222:     {Binary2, _} = split_binary(Binary, DebugInfoStart),
  223:     verify(chunk_too_big, beam_lib:chunks(Binary2, ["Dbgi"])),
  224:     {Binary3, _} = split_binary(Binary, DebugInfoStart-4),
  225:     verify(invalid_beam_file, beam_lib:chunks(Binary3, ["Dbgi"])),
  226: 
  227:     %% Instead of the 5:32 field below, there used to be control characters
  228:     %% (including zero bytes) directly in the string. Because inferior programs
  229:     %% such as sed and clearcasediff don't like zero bytes in text files,
  230:     %% we have eliminated them.
  231:     ok = file:write_file(BeamFile, <<"FOR1",5:32,"BEAMfel">>),
  232: 
  233:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  234:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  235:     file:delete(Source),
  236:     file:delete(WrongFile),
  237:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  238:     file:delete(ACopy),
  239:     ok.
  240: 
  241: last_chunk(Bin) ->
  242:     L = beam_lib:info(Bin),
  243:     {chunks,Chunks} = lists:keyfind(chunks, 1, L),
  244:     {Last,_,_} = lists:last(Chunks),
  245:     Last.
  246: 
  247: do_error(BeamFile, ACopy) ->
  248:     %% evil tests
  249:     Chunks = chunk_info(BeamFile),
  250:     {value, {_, AtomStart, _}} = lists:keysearch("AtU8", 1, Chunks),
  251:     {value, {_, ImportStart, _}} = lists:keysearch("ImpT", 1, Chunks),
  252:     {value, {_, DebugInfoStart, _}} = lists:keysearch("Dbgi", 1, Chunks),
  253:     {value, {_, AttributesStart, _}} =
  254: 	lists:keysearch("Attr", 1, Chunks),
  255:     {value, {_, CompileInfoStart, _}} =
  256: 	lists:keysearch("CInf", 1, Chunks),
  257:     verify(missing_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, ["__"])),
  258:     BF2 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, ImportStart+4, 17),
  259:     verify(invalid_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF2, [imports])),
  260:     BF3 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, AtomStart-6, 17),
  261:     verify(missing_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF3, [imports])),
  262:     BF4 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, DebugInfoStart+10, 17),
  263:     verify(invalid_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF4, [debug_info])),
  264:     BF5 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, AttributesStart+8, 17),
  265:     verify(invalid_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF5, [attributes])),
  266: 
  267:     BF6 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, 1, 17),
  268:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(BF6)),
  269:     BF7 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, 9, 17),
  270:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:info(BF7)),
  271: 
  272:     BF8 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, 13, 17),
  273:     verify(missing_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF8, ["AtU8"])),
  274: 
  275:     BF9 = set_byte(ACopy, BeamFile, CompileInfoStart+8, 17),
  276:     verify(invalid_chunk, beam_lib:chunks(BF9, [compile_info])).
  277: 
  278: 
  279: %% Compare contents of BEAM files and directories.
  280: cmp(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  281:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  282: 
  283:     Dir1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "dir1"),
  284:     Dir2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "dir2"),
  285: 
  286:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir1),
  287:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir2),
  288: 
  289:     {SourceD1, BeamFileD1} = make_beam(Dir1, simple, member),
  290:     {Source2D1, BeamFile2D1} = make_beam(Dir1, simple2, concat),
  291:     {SourceD2, BeamFileD2} = make_beam(Dir2, simple, concat),
  292: 
  293:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  294:     P0 = pps(),
  295: 
  296:     %% cmp
  297:     ok = beam_lib:cmp(BeamFileD1, BeamFileD1),
  298:     ver(modules_different, beam_lib:cmp(BeamFileD1, BeamFile2D1)),
  299:     ver(chunks_different, beam_lib:cmp(BeamFileD1, BeamFileD2)),
  300:     verify(file_error, beam_lib:cmp(foo, bar)),
  301: 
  302:     {ok, B1} = file:read_file(BeamFileD1),
  303:     ok = beam_lib:cmp(B1, BeamFileD1),
  304:     {ok, B2} = file:read_file(BeamFileD2),
  305:     ver(chunks_different, beam_lib:cmp(B1, B2)),
  306: 
  307:     %% cmp_dirs
  308:     {[],[],[]} = beam_lib:cmp_dirs(Dir1, Dir1),
  309:     true = {[BeamFile2D1], [], [{BeamFileD1,BeamFileD2}]} ==
  310: 	beam_lib:cmp_dirs(Dir1, Dir2),
  311:     true = {[], [BeamFile2D1], [{BeamFileD2,BeamFileD1}]} ==
  312: 	beam_lib:cmp_dirs(Dir2, Dir1),
  313:     ver(not_a_directory, beam_lib:cmp_dirs(foo, bar)),
  314: 
  315:     %% diff_dirs
  316:     ok = beam_lib:diff_dirs(Dir1, Dir1),
  317:     ver(not_a_directory, beam_lib:diff_dirs(foo, bar)),
  318: 
  319:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  320:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  321:     delete_files([SourceD1, BeamFileD1, Source2D1,
  322: 		  BeamFile2D1, SourceD2, BeamFileD2]),
  323: 
  324:     file:del_dir(Dir1),
  325:     file:del_dir(Dir2),
  326:     ok.
  327: 
  328: %% Compare contents of BEAM files having literals.
  329: cmp_literals(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  330:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  331: 
  332:     Dir1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "dir1"),
  333:     Dir2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "dir2"),
  334: 
  335:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir1),
  336:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir2),
  337: 
  338:     {SourceD1, BeamFileD1} = make_beam(Dir1, simple, constant),
  339:     {SourceD2, BeamFileD2} = make_beam(Dir2, simple, constant2),
  340: 
  341:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  342:     P0 = pps(),
  343: 
  344:     %% cmp
  345:     ok = beam_lib:cmp(BeamFileD1, BeamFileD1),
  346:     ver(chunks_different, beam_lib:cmp(BeamFileD1, BeamFileD2)),
  347: 
  348:     {ok, B1} = file:read_file(BeamFileD1),
  349:     ok = beam_lib:cmp(B1, BeamFileD1),
  350:     {ok, B2} = file:read_file(BeamFileD2),
  351:     ver(chunks_different, beam_lib:cmp(B1, B2)),
  352: 
  353:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  354:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  355: 
  356:     delete_files([SourceD1, BeamFileD1, SourceD2, BeamFileD2]),
  357: 
  358:     file:del_dir(Dir1),
  359:     file:del_dir(Dir2),
  360:     ok.
  361: 
  362: %% Strip BEAM files.
  363: strip(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  364:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  365:     {SourceD1, BeamFileD1} = make_beam(PrivDir, simple, member),
  366:     {Source2D1, BeamFile2D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, simple2, concat),
  367:     {Source3D1, BeamFile3D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, make_fun, make_fun),
  368:     {Source4D1, BeamFile4D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, constant, constant),
  369:     {Source5D1, BeamFile5D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, lines, lines),
  370: 
  371:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  372:     P0 = pps(),
  373: 
  374:     %% strip binary
  375:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:strip(<<>>)),
  376:     {ok, B1} = file:read_file(BeamFileD1),
  377:     {ok, {simple, NB1}} = beam_lib:strip(B1),
  378:     BId1 = chunk_ids(B1),
  379:     NBId1 = chunk_ids(NB1),
  380:     true = length(BId1) > length(NBId1),
  381:     compare_chunks(B1, NB1, NBId1),
  382: 
  383:     %% strip file
  384:     verify(file_error, beam_lib:strip(foo)),
  385:     {ok, {simple, _}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFileD1),
  386:     compare_chunks(NB1, BeamFileD1, NBId1),
  387: 
  388:     %% strip_files
  389:     {ok, B2} = file:read_file(BeamFile2D1),
  390:     {ok, [{simple,_},{simple2,_}]} = beam_lib:strip_files([B1, B2]),
  391:     {ok, [{simple,_},{simple2,_},{make_fun,_},{constant,_}]} =
  392: 	beam_lib:strip_files([BeamFileD1, BeamFile2D1, BeamFile3D1, BeamFile4D1]),
  393: 
  394:     %% strip a complex module
  395:     OrigSofsPath = code:where_is_file("sofs.beam"),
  396:     BeamFileSofs = filename:join(PrivDir,"sofs.beam"),
  397:     file:copy(OrigSofsPath, BeamFileSofs),
  398:     {ok, {sofs,_}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFileSofs),
  399:     code:unstick_mod(sofs),
  400:     false = code:purge(sofs),
  401: 
  402:     %% check that each module can be loaded.
  403:     {module, simple} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFileD1)),
  404:     {module, simple2} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile2D1)),
  405:     {module, make_fun} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile3D1)),
  406:     {module, constant} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile4D1)),
  407:     {module, sofs} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFileSofs)),
  408: 
  409:     %% check that line number information is still present after stripping
  410:     {module, lines} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile5D1)),
  411:     Info = get_line_number_info(),
  412:     true = code:delete(lines),
  413:     false = code:purge(lines),
  414:     {ok, {lines,BeamFile5D1}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFile5D1),
  415:     {module, lines} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile5D1)),
  416:     Info = get_line_number_info(),
  417: 
  418:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  419:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  420: 
  421:     delete_files([SourceD1, BeamFileD1,
  422: 		  Source2D1, BeamFile2D1,
  423: 		  Source3D1, BeamFile3D1,
  424: 		  Source4D1, BeamFile4D1,
  425: 		  Source5D1, BeamFile5D1,
  426:                   BeamFileSofs]),
  427: 
  428:     false = code:purge(sofs),
  429:     {module, sofs} = code:load_file(sofs),
  430:     code:stick_mod(sofs),
  431:     ok.
  432: 
  433: strip_add_chunks(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  434:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  435:     {SourceD1, BeamFileD1} = make_beam(PrivDir, simple, member),
  436:     {Source2D1, BeamFile2D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, simple2, concat),
  437:     {Source3D1, BeamFile3D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, make_fun, make_fun),
  438:     {Source4D1, BeamFile4D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, constant, constant),
  439:     {Source5D1, BeamFile5D1} = make_beam(PrivDir, lines, lines),
  440: 
  441:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  442:     P0 = pps(),
  443: 
  444:     %% strip binary
  445:     verify(not_a_beam_file, beam_lib:strip(<<>>)),
  446:     {ok, B1} = file:read_file(BeamFileD1),
  447:     {ok, {simple, NB1}} = beam_lib:strip(B1),
  448: 
  449:     BId1 = chunk_ids(B1),
  450:     NBId1 = chunk_ids(NB1),
  451:     true = length(BId1) > length(NBId1),
  452:     compare_chunks(B1, NB1, NBId1),
  453: 
  454:     %% Keep all the extra chunks
  455:     ExtraChunks = ["Abst", "Dbgi", "Attr", "CInf", "Docs", "LocT", "Atom"],
  456:     {ok, {simple, AB1}} = beam_lib:strip(B1, ExtraChunks),
  457:     ABId1 = chunk_ids(AB1),
  458:     true = length(BId1) == length(ABId1),
  459:     compare_chunks(B1, AB1, ABId1),
  460: 
  461:     %% strip file - Keep extra chunks
  462:     verify(file_error, beam_lib:strip(foo)),
  463:     {ok, {simple, _}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFileD1, ExtraChunks),
  464:     compare_chunks(B1, BeamFileD1, ABId1),
  465: 
  466:     %% strip_files
  467:     {ok, B2} = file:read_file(BeamFile2D1),
  468:     {ok, [{simple,_},{simple2,_}]} = beam_lib:strip_files([B1, B2], ExtraChunks),
  469:     {ok, [{simple,_},{simple2,_},{make_fun,_},{constant,_}]} =
  470: 	beam_lib:strip_files([BeamFileD1, BeamFile2D1, BeamFile3D1, BeamFile4D1], ExtraChunks),
  471: 
  472:     %% strip a complex module
  473:     OrigSofsPath = code:where_is_file("sofs.beam"),
  474:     BeamFileSofs = filename:join(PrivDir,"sofs.beam"),
  475:     file:copy(OrigSofsPath, BeamFileSofs),
  476:     {ok, {sofs,_}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFileSofs, ExtraChunks),
  477:     code:unstick_mod(sofs),
  478:     false = code:purge(sofs),
  479: 
  480:     %% check that each module can be loaded.
  481:     {module, simple} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFileD1)),
  482:     {module, simple2} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile2D1)),
  483:     {module, make_fun} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile3D1)),
  484:     {module, constant} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile4D1)),
  485:     {module, sofs} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFileSofs)),
  486: 
  487:     %% check that line number information is still present after stripping
  488:     {module, lines} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile5D1)),
  489:     Info = get_line_number_info(),
  490:     false = code:purge(lines),
  491:     true = code:delete(lines),
  492:     {ok, {lines,BeamFile5D1}} = beam_lib:strip(BeamFile5D1),
  493:     {module, lines} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(BeamFile5D1)),
  494:     Info = get_line_number_info(),
  495: 
  496:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  497:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  498: 
  499:     delete_files([SourceD1, BeamFileD1,
  500: 		  Source2D1, BeamFile2D1,
  501: 		  Source3D1, BeamFile3D1,
  502: 		  Source4D1, BeamFile4D1,
  503: 		  Source5D1, BeamFile5D1,
  504:                   BeamFileSofs]),
  505: 
  506:     false = code:purge(sofs),
  507:     {module, sofs} = code:load_file(sofs),
  508:     code:stick_mod(sofs),
  509: 
  510:     ok.
  511: 
  512: otp_6711(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  513:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:info(3)}),
  514:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:chunks(a, b)}),
  515:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:chunks(a,b,c)}),
  516:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:all_chunks(3)}),
  517:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:cmp(3,4)}),
  518:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch {a, beam_lib:strip(3)}),
  519:     {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} =
  520:         (catch {a, beam_lib:strip_files([3])}),
  521: 
  522:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  523:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "dir"),
  524:     Lib = filename:join(Dir, "lib"),
  525:     App = filename:join(Lib, "app"),
  526:     EBin = filename:join(App, "ebin"),
  527: 
  528:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  529:     ok = file:make_dir(Lib),
  530:     ok = file:make_dir(App),
  531:     ok = file:make_dir(EBin),
  532: 
  533:     {SourceD, BeamFileD} = make_beam(EBin, simple, member),
  534: 
  535:     unwritable(BeamFileD),
  536: 
  537:     %% There is no way that strip_release can fail with
  538:     %% function_clause or something like that...
  539:     {error,_,{file_error,_,_}} = beam_lib:strip_release(Dir),
  540: 
  541:     delete_files([SourceD, BeamFileD]),
  542:     file:del_dir(EBin),
  543:     file:del_dir(App),
  544:     file:del_dir(Lib),
  545:     file:del_dir(Dir),
  546:     ok.
  547: 
  548: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
  549: 
  550: unwritable(Fname) ->
  551:     {ok, Info} = file:read_file_info(Fname),
  552:     Mode = Info#file_info.mode - 8#00200,
  553:     file:write_file_info(Fname, Info#file_info{mode = Mode}).
  554: 
  555: %% Testing building of BEAM files.
  556: building(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  557:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  558: 
  559:     Dir1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "b_dir1"),
  560:     Dir2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "b_dir2"),
  561: 
  562:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir1),
  563:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir2),
  564: 
  565:     {SourceD1, BeamFileD1} = make_beam(Dir1, building, member),
  566: 
  567:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  568:     P0 = pps(),
  569: 
  570:     %% read all chunks
  571:     ChunkIds = chunk_ids(BeamFileD1),
  572:     {ok, _Mod, Chunks} = beam_lib:all_chunks(BeamFileD1),
  573:     ChunkIds = lists:map(fun ({Id, Data}) when is_binary(Data) -> Id
  574: 			 end, Chunks),
  575: 
  576:     %% write a new beam file, with reversed chunk order
  577:     BeamFileD2 = filename:join(Dir2, "building.beam"),
  578:     {ok,RevBeam} = beam_lib:build_module(lists:reverse(Chunks)),
  579:     file:write_file(BeamFileD2, RevBeam),
  580: 
  581:     %% compare files
  582:     compare_chunks(BeamFileD1, BeamFileD2, ChunkIds),
  583: 
  584:     %% test that we can retrieve a chunk before the atom table
  585:     %% (actually, try to retrieve all chunks)
  586: 
  587:     lists:foreach(fun(Id) ->
  588: 			  {ok, {building, [{Id, _Data}]}} =
  589: 			      beam_lib:chunks(BeamFileD1, [Id])
  590: 		  end, ChunkIds),
  591:     lists:foreach(fun(Id) ->
  592: 			  {ok, {building, [{Id, _Data}]}} =
  593: 			      beam_lib:chunks(BeamFileD2, [Id])
  594: 		  end, ChunkIds),
  595: 
  596:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  597:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  598: 
  599:     delete_files([SourceD1, BeamFileD1, BeamFileD2]),
  600:     file:del_dir(Dir1),
  601:     file:del_dir(Dir2),
  602:     ok.
  603: 
  604: %% Compare beam_lib:md5/1 and code:module_md5/1.
  605: md5(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  606:     Beams = collect_beams(),
  607:     io:format("Found ~w beam files", [length(Beams)]),
  608:     md5_1(Beams).
  609: 
  610: md5_1([N|Ns]) ->
  611:     {ok,Beam0} = file:read_file(N),
  612:     Beam = maybe_uncompress(Beam0),
  613:     {ok,{Mod,MD5}} = beam_lib:md5(Beam),
  614:     {Mod,MD5} = {Mod,code:module_md5(Beam)},
  615:     md5_1(Ns);
  616: md5_1([]) -> ok.
  617: 
  618: collect_beams() ->
  619:     SuperDir = filename:dirname(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))),
  620:     TestDirs = filelib:wildcard(filename:join([SuperDir,"*_test"])),
  621:     AbsDirs = [filename:absname(X) || X <- code:get_path()],
  622:     collect_beams_1(AbsDirs ++ TestDirs).
  623: 
  624: collect_beams_1([Dir|Dirs]) ->
  625:     filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "*.beam")) ++ collect_beams_1(Dirs);
  626: collect_beams_1([]) -> [].
  627: 
  628: maybe_uncompress(<<"FOR1",_/binary>>=Beam) -> Beam;
  629: maybe_uncompress(Beam) -> zlib:gunzip(Beam).
  630: 
  631: %% Test encrypted abstract format.
  632: encrypted_abstr(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  633:     run_if_crypto_works(fun() -> encrypted_abstr_1(Conf) end).
  634: 
  635: encrypted_abstr_1(Conf) ->
  636:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  637:     Simple = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple"),
  638:     Source = Simple ++ ".erl",
  639:     BeamFile = Simple ++ ".beam",
  640:     simple_file(Source),
  641: 
  642:     %% Avoid getting an extra port when crypto starts erl_ddll.
  643:     erl_ddll:start(),
  644: 
  645:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  646:     P0 = pps(),
  647: 
  648:     Key = "#a_crypto_key",
  649:     CompileFlags = [{outdir,PrivDir}, debug_info, {debug_info_key,Key}],
  650:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, CompileFlags),
  651:     {ok, Binary} = file:read_file(BeamFile),
  652: 
  653:     do_encrypted_abstr(BeamFile, Key),
  654:     do_encrypted_abstr(Binary, Key),
  655: 
  656:     ok = application:stop(crypto),			%To get rid of extra ets tables.
  657:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  658:     file:delete(Source),
  659:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  660:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  661:     ok.
  662: 
  663: do_encrypted_abstr(Beam, Key) ->
  664:     verify(key_missing_or_invalid, beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [debug_info])),
  665: 
  666:     %% The raw chunk "Dbgi" can still be read even without a key.
  667:     {ok,{simple,[{"Dbgi",Dbgi}]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, ["Dbgi"]),
  668:     <<0:8,8:8,"des3_cbc",_/binary>> = Dbgi,
  669: 
  670:     %% Try som invalid funs.
  671:     bad_fun(badfun, fun() -> ok end),
  672:     bad_fun(badfun, {a,b}),
  673:     bad_fun(blurf),
  674:     {function_clause,_} = bad_fun(fun(glurf) -> ok end),
  675: 
  676:     %% Funs that return something strange.
  677:     bad_fun(badfun, fun(init) -> {ok,fun() -> ok end} end),
  678:     glurf = bad_fun(fun(init) -> {error,glurf} end),
  679: 
  680:     %% Try clearing (non-existing fun).
  681:     undefined = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  682: 
  683:     %% Install a fun which cannot retrieve a key.
  684:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(fun(init) -> ok end),
  685:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  686: 
  687:     %% Install a fun which returns an incorrect key.
  688:     {ok,_} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  689:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(simple_crypto_fun("wrong key...")),
  690:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  691: 
  692:     %% Installing a new key fun is not possible without clearing the old.
  693:     verify(exists, beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(simple_crypto_fun(Key))),
  694: 
  695:     %% Install the simplest possible working key fun.
  696:     {ok,_} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  697:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(simple_crypto_fun(Key)),
  698:     verify_abstract(Beam),
  699:     {ok,{simple,[{"Dbgi",Dbgi}]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, ["Dbgi"]),
  700: 
  701:     %% Installing a new key fun is not possible without clearing the old.
  702:     verify(exists, beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(ets_crypto_fun(Key))),
  703: 
  704:     %% Install a key using an ets table.
  705:     {ok,_} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  706:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(ets_crypto_fun(Key)),
  707:     verify_abstract(Beam),
  708:     {ok,{simple,[{"Dbgi",Dbgi}]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, ["Dbgi"]),
  709: 
  710:     {ok,cleared} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  711: 
  712:     %% Try to force a stop/start race.
  713:     start_stop_race(10000),
  714: 
  715:     ok.
  716: 
  717: start_stop_race(0) ->
  718:     ok;
  719: start_stop_race(N) ->
  720:     {error,_} = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(bad_fun),
  721:     undefined = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  722:     start_stop_race(N-1).
  723: 
  724: bad_fun(F) ->
  725:     {error,E} = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(F),
  726:     E.
  727: 
  728: bad_fun(S, F) ->
  729:     verify(S, beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(F)).
  730: 
  731: verify_abstract(Beam) ->
  732:     {ok,{simple,[Abst, Dbgi]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code, debug_info]),
  733:     {abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,_}} = Abst,
  734:     {debug_info,{debug_info_v1,erl_abstract_code,_}} = Dbgi.
  735: 
  736: simple_crypto_fun(Key) ->
  737:     fun(init) -> ok;
  738:        ({debug_info, des3_cbc, simple, _}) -> Key
  739:     end.
  740: 
  741: ets_crypto_fun(Key) ->
  742:     fun(init) ->
  743: 	    T = ets:new(beam_lib_SUITE_keys, [private, set]),
  744: 	    true = ets:insert(T, {key,Key}),
  745: 	    {ok,fun({debug_info, des3_cbc, simple, _}) ->
  746: 			[{key,Val}] = ets:lookup(T, key),
  747: 			Val;
  748: 		   (clear) ->
  749: 			ets:delete(T),
  750: 			cleared
  751: 		end}
  752:     end.
  753: 
  754: %% Test encrypted abstract format with the key in .erlang.crypt.
  755: encrypted_abstr_file(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  756:     run_if_crypto_works(fun() -> encrypted_abstr_file_1(Conf) end).
  757: 
  758: encrypted_abstr_file_1(Conf) ->
  759:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  760:     Simple = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple"),
  761:     Source = Simple ++ ".erl",
  762:     BeamFile = Simple ++ ".beam",
  763:     simple_file(Source),
  764: 
  765:     %% Avoid getting an extra port when crypto starts erl_ddll.
  766:     erl_ddll:start(),
  767: 
  768:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  769:     P0 = pps(),
  770: 
  771:     Key = "Long And niCe 99Krypto Key",
  772:     CompileFlags = [{outdir,PrivDir}, debug_info, {debug_info_key,Key}],
  773:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Source, CompileFlags),
  774:     {ok, Binary} = file:read_file(BeamFile),
  775: 
  776:     {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  777:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  778:     do_encrypted_abstr_file(BeamFile, Key),
  779:     do_encrypted_abstr_file(Binary, Key),
  780:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldCwd),
  781: 
  782:     ok = application:stop(crypto),			%To get rid of extra ets tables.
  783:     file:delete(filename:join(PrivDir, ".erlang.crypt")),
  784:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  785:     file:delete(Source),
  786:     NoOfTables = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  787:     true = (P0 == pps()),
  788:     ok.
  789: 
  790: do_encrypted_abstr_file(Beam, Key) ->
  791:     %% No key.
  792:     write_crypt_file(""),
  793:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  794: 
  795:     %% A wrong key.
  796:     write_crypt_file(["[{debug_info,des3_cbc,simple,\"A Wrong Key\"}].\n"]),
  797:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  798: 
  799:     %% Write correct key...
  800:     write_crypt_file(["[{debug_info,des3_cbc,simple,\"",Key,"\"}].\n"]),
  801: 
  802:     %% ... but the fun with the wrong key is still there.
  803:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  804: 
  805:     %% Clear the fun. Now it should work.
  806:     {ok,_} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  807:     verify_abstract(Beam),
  808:     verify_abstract(Beam),
  809:     ok = file:delete(".erlang.crypt"),
  810:     verify_abstract(Beam),
  811: 
  812:     %% Clear, otherwise the second pass will fail.
  813:     {ok,_} = beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  814:     {error,beam_lib,Error} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  815:     ok.
  816: 
  817: test_makedep_abstract_code(Conf) ->
  818:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  819:     ErlFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "hello.erl"),
  820:     BeamFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "hello.beam"),
  821:     file:write_file(ErlFile,
  822: 		    ["-module(hello).\n",
  823: 		     "-export([start/0]).\n",
  824: 		     "start() -> ok.\n"
  825: 		    ]),
  826:     DependDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "depend"),
  827:     file:make_dir(DependDir),
  828:     DependFile = filename:join(DependDir,"hello.d"),
  829:     compile:file(ErlFile,
  830: 		 [debug_info,
  831: 		  makedep_side_effect,
  832: 		  {outdir, PrivDir},
  833: 		  {makedep_output, DependFile}]),
  834:     file:delete(DependFile),
  835:     file:del_dir(DependDir),
  836:     case beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [debug_info]) of
  837: 	{ok, {Module, [{debug_info, {debug_info_v1,
  838: 				     _Backend=erl_abstract_code,Metadata}}]}} ->
  839: 	    SrcOpts = [no_copt, to_core, binary, return_errors,
  840: 		       no_inline, strict_record_tests, strict_record_updates,
  841: 		       dialyzer, no_spawn_compiler_process],
  842: 	    {ok,_} = erl_abstract_code:debug_info(core_v1, Module, Metadata,
  843: 						  SrcOpts),
  844:             ok
  845:     end.
  846:     
  847: 
  848: write_crypt_file(Contents0) ->
  849:     Contents = list_to_binary([Contents0]),
  850:     io:format("~s\n", [binary_to_list(Contents)]),
  851:     ok = file:write_file(".erlang.crypt", Contents).
  852: 
  853: %% GH-4353: Don't crash when the backend for generating the abstract code
  854: %% is missing.
  855: missing_debug_info_backend(Conf) ->
  856:     PrivDir = ?privdir,
  857:     Simple = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple"),
  858:     Source = Simple ++ ".erl",
  859:     BeamFile = Simple ++ ".beam",
  860:     simple_file(Source),
  861: 
  862:     %% Create a debug_info chunk with a non-existing backend.
  863:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Source, [{outdir,PrivDir}]),
  864:     {ok,simple,All0} = beam_lib:all_chunks(BeamFile),
  865:     FakeBackend = definitely__not__an__existing__backend,
  866:     FakeDebugInfo = {debug_info_v1, FakeBackend, nothing_here},
  867:     All = lists:keyreplace("Dbgi", 1, All0, {"Dbgi", term_to_binary(FakeDebugInfo)}),
  868:     {ok,NewBeam} = beam_lib:build_module(All),
  869:     ok = file:write_file(BeamFile, NewBeam),
  870: 
  871:     %% beam_lib should not crash, but return an error.
  872:     verify(missing_backend, beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [abstract_code])),
  873:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  874: 
  875:     ok.
  876: 
  877: compare_chunks(File1, File2, ChunkIds) ->
  878:     {ok, {_, Chunks1}} = beam_lib:chunks(File1, ChunkIds),
  879:     {ok, {_, Chunks2}} = beam_lib:chunks(File2, ChunkIds),
  880:     true = Chunks1 == Chunks2.
  881: 
  882: chunk_ids(File) ->
  883:     lists:map(fun({Id,_Start,_Size}) -> Id end, chunk_info(File)).
  884: 
  885: chunk_info(File) ->
  886:     {value, {chunks, Chunks}} =
  887: 	lists:keysearch(chunks, 1, beam_lib:info(File)),
  888:     Chunks.
  889: 
  890: make_beam(Dir, Module, F) ->
  891:     FileBase = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(Module)),
  892:     Source = FileBase ++ ".erl",
  893:     BeamFile = FileBase ++ ".beam",
  894:     file:delete(BeamFile),
  895:     simple_file(Source, Module, F),
  896:     {ok, _} = compile:file(Source, [{outdir,Dir}, debug_info, report]),
  897:     {Source, BeamFile}.
  898: 
  899: set_byte(_Backup, Binary, Pos, Byte) when is_binary(Binary) ->
  900:     <<B1:Pos/binary, _:1/binary, B2/binary>> = Binary,
  901:     NB = <<B1/binary, Byte:8, B2/binary>>,
  902:     NB;
  903: set_byte(Backup, File, Pos, Byte) ->
  904:     copy_file(Backup, File),
  905:     set_byte(File, Pos, Byte),
  906:     File.
  907: 
  908: set_byte(File, Pos, Byte) ->
  909:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read, write]),
  910:     {ok, _} = file:position(Fd, Pos),
  911:     ok = file:write(Fd, [Byte]),
  912:     file:close(Fd).
  913: 
  914: copy_file(Src, Dest) ->
  915:     {ok, _} = file:copy(Src, Dest),
  916:     ok = file:change_mode(Dest, 8#0666).
  917: 
  918: delete_files(Files) ->
  919:     lists:foreach(fun(F) -> file:delete(F) end, Files).
  920: 
  921: verify(S, {error, beam_lib, R}) ->
  922:     verify_error(S, R);
  923: verify(S, {error, R}) ->
  924:     verify_error(S, R).
  925: 
  926: verify_error(S, R) ->
  927:     if
  928: 	S =:= R -> ok;
  929: 	true -> [S|_] = tuple_to_list(R)
  930:     end,
  931: 
  932:     %% Most formatted messages begin with "./simple.beam:" or "<<...".
  933:     FM = string:str(lists:flatten(beam_lib:format_error(R)), "simpl") > 0,
  934:     BM = string:str(lists:flatten(beam_lib:format_error(R)), "<<") > 0,
  935: 
  936:     %% Also make sure that formatted message is not just the term printed.
  937:     Handled = beam_lib:format_error(R) =/= io_lib:format("~p~n", [R]),
  938:     true = ((FM > 0) or (BM > 0)) and Handled.
  939: 
  940: ver(S, {error, beam_lib, R}) ->
  941:     [S|_] = tuple_to_list(R),
  942:     case lists:flatten(beam_lib:format_error(R)) of
  943: 	[${ | _] ->
  944: 	    ct:fail({bad_format_error, R});
  945: 	_ ->
  946: 	    ok
  947:     end.
  948: 
  949: pps() ->
  950:     {erlang:ports()}.
  951: 
  952: simple_file(File) ->
  953:     simple_file(File, simple).
  954: 
  955: simple_file(File, Module) ->
  956:     simple_file(File, Module, member).
  957: 
  958: simple_file(File, Module, make_fun) ->
  959:     B = list_to_binary(["-module(", atom_to_list(Module), "). "
  960: 			"-export([t/1]). "
  961: 			"t(A) -> "
  962: 			"    fun(X) -> A+X end. "]),
  963:     ok = file:write_file(File, B);
  964: simple_file(File, Module, constant) ->
  965:     B = list_to_binary(["-module(", atom_to_list(Module), "). "
  966: 			"-export([t/1]). "
  967: 			"t(A) -> "
  968: 			"    {a,b,[2,3],c,d}. "]),
  969:     ok = file:write_file(File, B);
  970: simple_file(File, Module, constant2) ->
  971:     B = list_to_binary(["-module(", atom_to_list(Module), "). "
  972: 			"-export([t/1]). "
  973: 			"t(A) -> "
  974: 			"    {a,b,[2,3],x,y}. "]),
  975:     ok = file:write_file(File, B);
  976: simple_file(File, Module, lines) ->
  977:     B = list_to_binary(["-module(", atom_to_list(Module), ").\n"
  978: 			"-export([t/1]).\n"
  979: 			"t(A) ->\n"
  980: 			"    A+1.\n"]),
  981:     ok = file:write_file(File, B);
  982: simple_file(File, Module, F) ->
  983:     B = list_to_binary(["-module(", atom_to_list(Module), "). "
  984: 			"-export([t/0]). "
  985: 			"t() -> "
  986: 			"    t([]). "
  987: 			"t(L) -> "
  988: 			"    lists:", 
  989: 			atom_to_list(F), "(a, L). "]),
  990:     ok = file:write_file(File, B).
  991: 
  992: run_if_crypto_works(Test) ->
  993:     try	begin application:start(crypto), application:stop(crypto), ok end of
  994: 	ok ->
  995: 	    Test()
  996:     catch
  997: 	error:_ ->
  998: 	    {skip,"The crypto application is missing or broken"}
  999:     end.
 1000: 
 1001: get_line_number_info() ->
 1002:     %% The stacktrace for operators such a '+' can vary depending on
 1003:     %% whether the JIT is used or not.
 1004:     case catch lines:t(atom) of
 1005:         {'EXIT',{badarith,[{erlang,'+',[atom,1],_},
 1006:                            {lines,t,1,Info}|_]}} ->
 1007:             Info;
 1008:         {'EXIT',{badarith,[{lines,t,1,Info}|_]}} ->
 1009:             Info
 1010:     end.
